comments.body:
Created attachment 17496
Patch to switch from Jakarta to ASF logo on FAQ pages

Thanks for your efforts but I am afraid they are to no avail. The docs are
generated from xml files so it is these that need patching. In fact, it is
probably a single line in the project file. Take a look at
http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/site/trunk/README.txt which describes how
the docs are built.

If you are quick, you might get there before I get around to it ;)
Fixed. Main web site updated. Thanks for the report.

Grrr!!!  I should have read the README.  Oh well--now I know.

Thanks,
Glen

description:
This patch switches the logo on all the FAQ pages[1] from showing the Jakarta
logo to showing the ASF logo instead (similar to the top of the main Tomcat page[2])

[1] http://tomcat.apache.org/faq/
[2] http://tomcat.apache.org/

Also, for the printing-friendly versions of the FAQ site pages, I removed the
logos at the top completely, so printing doesn't have to using ink on them.  If
viewed as a problem, they can be quickly reinserted.
summary: [PATCH] Patch to change to ASF logo on FAQ pages
